name: Dragon's Lair
description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

key_work.title: Dragon's Lair
key_work.brief_description: Dragonâ€™s Lair looks more like a cartoon than a videogame. That’s because it was animated by Don Bluth, the legend behind The Land Before Time (1988), and its LaserDisc technology allowed for dramatically better graphics and sound than other games of the era.

constellations_primary.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_primary.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

start.title: Journey Back to Oz
start.creator_credit: Hal Sutherland, Fred Ladd and Norm Prescott
start.brief_description: Revisit the enchanting Land of Oz as Dorothy and Toto return to find the Scarecrow as ruler of the Emerald City. Unfortunately for the new mayor, the wicked Mombi is conspiring to take over the city for herself.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

end.title: The Wizard of Oz
end.creator_credit: Arthur Freed, Mervyn LeRoy, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Malcolm Brown and Adrian
end.brief_description: When a tornado rips through Kansas, Dorothy (Judy Garland) and her dog, Toto, are whisked away in their house to the magical land of Oz. They follow the Yellow Brick Road toward the Emerald City to meet the Wizard, and encounter a Scarecrow, a Tin Man and a Cowardly Lion.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Communicating colour
constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

constellations_other.name: Colour and creativity
constellations_other.description: From dying film to Technicolor and beyond, creative applications of colour have been part of cinema since its inception.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: Dorothy was voiced by Liza Minelli in this animated film. The role would most famously be played by her mother Judy Garland in the 1939 classic.

start.title: The Secret of NIMH
start.creator_credit: Gary Goldman, John Pomeroy, Don Bluth and Aurora
start.brief_description: A widowed field mouse must move her family — including an ailing son — to escape a farmer’s plow. Aided by a crow and a pack of superintelligent, escaped lab rats, the brave mother struggles to transplant her home to firmer ground.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

end.title: Journey Back to Oz
end.creator_credit: Hal Sutherland, Fred Ladd and Norm Prescott
end.brief_description: Revisit the enchanting Land of Oz as Dorothy and Toto return to find the Scarecrow as ruler of the Emerald City. Unfortunately for the new mayor, the wicked Mombi is conspiring to take over the city for herself.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: Prior to starting his own studio, Don Bluth worked for Disney on several films, as well as contributing art and animation to other studios, including this film loosely based on the sequel to L Frank Baum’s ‘The Wizard of Oz’.

start.title: Journey Back to Oz
start.creator_credit: Hal Sutherland, Fred Ladd and Norm Prescott
start.brief_description: Revisit the enchanting Land of Oz as Dorothy and Toto return to find the Scarecrow as ruler of the Emerald City. Unfortunately for the new mayor, the wicked Mombi is conspiring to take over the city for herself.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

end.title: The Wiz
end.brief_description: Dorothy Gale, a shy kindergarten teacher is swept away to the magic land of Oz where she embarks on a quest to return home

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: Minelli was close friends with musician Michael Jackson, who played the character of the Scarecrow in this 1978 re-imagining of the Oz story - and which famously flopped at the box office.

start.title: Stranger Things
start.brief_description: When a young boy vanishes, a small town uncovers a mystery involving secret experiments, terrifying supernatural forces, and one strange little girl in Netflix’s blockbuster retro series.

constellations_other.name: Expansive light in science fiction and fantasy
constellations_other.description: Visual artists have identified the importance of light in revealing the expansiveness of our universe. Explore how artistsâ€™ perception of light has been adapted and referenced in science fiction and fantasy on screen.

constellations_other.name: The Suspense Constellation
constellations_other.description: An exploration of music in suspense works.

constellations_other.name: Electric sound supercut: composers and their distinctive other worlds
constellations_other.description: Electric sound is commonly associated with science fiction narratives for its auditory oddness, which has symbolised other worldly environments, the unconscious and the 1980s.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

end.title: Poltergeist
end.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Steven Spielberg and Paul Huston
end.brief_description: One of the most famous horror movies of all time follows a family trying to deal with their haunted house by calling in parapsychologists. It’s also considered a cursed film because of tragedies associated with its production.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: The Duffer Bros directly and indirectly reference many classic films from the 1980s. In a series two episode, Eleven sits in a darkened room in front of a static filled television, visually recreating the memorable shot from Poltergeist.

start.title: Ghostbusters
start.creator_credit: Ivan Reitman, Michael C. Gross, Joe Medjuck and John DeCuir
start.brief_description: After losing their academic posts at a prestigious university, a team of parapsychologists goes into business as proton-pack-toting “ghostbusters” who exterminate ghouls, hobgoblins and supernatural pests of all stripes. An ad campaign pays off when a knockout cellist hires the squad to purge her swanky digs of demons that appear to be living in her refrigerator.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

end.title: Bustin
end.brief_description: Internet comedy and meme-generator extraordinaire Neil Cicierega (Potter Puppet Pals) creates a video / audio remix of Ray Parker Jnr’s classic film theme that isn’t soon forgotten.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: Internet comedy creator Neil Cicierega’s video/audio remix is a hilarious meme-inspiring take on Ray Parker Jnr’s classic ‘Ghostbusters’ theme.

start.title: Dragon's Lair
start.brief_description: Dragonâ€™s Lair looks more like a cartoon than a videogame. That’s because it was animated by Don Bluth, the legend behind The Land Before Time (1988), and its LaserDisc technology allowed for dramatically better graphics and sound than other games of the era.

end.brief_description: A widowed field mouse must move her family — including an ailing son — to escape a farmer’s plow. Aided by a crow and a pack of superintelligent, escaped lab rats, the brave mother struggles to transplant her home to firmer ground.

constellations_other.name: Dragon's Lair
constellations_other.description: A look at pop-cultural interconnections that spawn from the lair of Don Bluth's arcade classic.

links.description: Dragon’s Lair was the first videogame to feature extensive animated sequences on LaserDisc. Animated by industry legend Don Bluth, game creator Rick Dyer was inspired after seeing Bluth’s film The Secret of Nimh.

links.description: The young cast of Stranger Things reference the 1984 film as they dress up in the iconic suits of the Ghostbusting team for Halloween.

links.description: The opening sequence in the second season of supernatural series Stranger Things sees the young cast battling it out on an arcade cabinet of Dragon’s Lair.
